title: Manfred Moore
text:
Manfred Moore (December 22, 1950 – January 11, 2020) was an American <a href="Professional%20sports">professional</a> <a href="American%20football">American football</a> <a href="running%20back">running back</a> and, briefly, <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1970s.
Early years.
Moore was born in <a href="Martinez%2C%20California">Martinez, California</a>. He graduated from San Fernando High School in San Fernando, California. He played <a href="college%20football">college football</a> for the <a href="University%20of%20Southern%20California">University of Southern California</a>.
Professional career.
NFL career.
Moore was a 9th round selection (216th overall) in the <a href="1974%20NFL%20Draft">1974 NFL Draft</a> by the <a href="San%20Francisco%2049ers">San Francisco 49ers</a>. He played for the 49ers in 1974 and 1975, being named their special teams player of the year in both seasons. He then spent the <a href="1976%20NFL%20season">1976 NFL season</a> with the <a href="Tampa%20Bay%20Buccaneers">Tampa Bay Buccaneers</a>, after being selected by them in the <a href="1976%20NFL%20expansion%20draft">1976 NFL expansion draft</a>. Near the end of the 1976 season he was cut by the winless Buccaneers (0-13 at that point) and signed by the <a href="Oakland%20Raiders">Oakland Raiders</a> to replace their injured kick returner <a href="Rick%20Jennings">Rick Jennings</a>.
Switch to rugby league.
Following his Super Bowl appearance, Moore was recruited by Australian <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20premiership">New South Wales Rugby Football League premiership</a> team the <a href="Newtown%20Jets">Newtown Jets</a> for the <a href="1977%20NSWRFL%20season">1977 NSWRFL season</a>, with the move being financed by <a href="John%20Singleton%20%28Australian%20entrepreneur%29">John Singleton</a>. He made his first grade debut just 98 days after the Super Bowl, playing on the wing against the <a href="Western%20Suburbs%20Magpies">Western Suburbs Magpies</a> before 5,743 spectators at <a href="Henson%20Park">Henson Park</a>. He impressed on debut, scoring the club's first try of the season. This made him the first, and to date only, person to score a first grade rugby league try in Australia and an NFL touchdown in the US. Moore lasted only four games in the NSWRFL; he was relegated to reserve grade and played in the second row before receiving a head injury in a match against <a href="Penrith%20Panthers">Penrith</a> which prompted him to return to the <a href="National%20Football%20League">National Football League</a> prematurely.
Return to the NFL.
Moore returned to the <a href="National%20Football%20League">National Football League</a> with the <a href="Minnesota%20Vikings">Minnesota Vikings</a>, playing twelve games in the <a href="1977%20NFL%20season">1977 NFL season</a>.
